clinical_study.brief_title: An Open, Randomized Pilot Study to Evaluate the Use of Basiliximab With an Optimized Cyclosporine Dosing on Renal Function in "de Novo" Liver Transplantation.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Randomized Pilot Study to Evaluate the Use of Basiliximab With an Optimized Cyclosporine Dosing on Renal Function in "de Novo" Liver Transplantation.

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of the study are:To compare the renal function of a quadruple immunosuppressive regimen (including basiliximab in combination with an optimized cyclosporine dose during the first weeks post-transplantation, mycophenolate mofetil and corticosteroids) versus a standard triple therapy regimen (including cyclosporine standard dose, mycophenolate mofetil and corticosteroids)

primary_outcome.measure: Renal function (i.e. glomerular filtration rate) at 12 months post-transplantation

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and severity of rejection episodes before 6 and 12 months post-transplantation
Frequency of death, graft loss or retransplantation before 6 and 12 months post-transplantation
Duration of initial hospitalization and number or hospital re-admissions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- First cadaveric liver transplant
- ABO identical or compatible graft
Exclusion Criteria
- Multiple organ transplant
- renal impairment defined as glomerular filtration rate (GFR) < 30 ml/min
- Fulminant liver failure
Other protocol-defined exclusion criteria may apply.
